glsa.title: Wireshark: Multiple Denials of Service
glsa.synopsis: Multiple Denial of Service vulnerabilities have been discovered in Wireshark.

background.p: Wireshark is a network protocol analyzer with a graphical front-end.

ul.li: Multiple buffer overflows in the NCP dissector (CVE-2008-3146).
Infinite loop in the NCP dissector (CVE-2008-3932).
Invalid read in the tvb_uncompress() function when processing zlib compressed data (CVE-2008-3933).
Unspecified error when processing Textronix .rf5 files (CVE-2008-3934).

impact.p: A remote attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities by sending specially crafted packets on a network being monitored by Wireshark or by enticing a user to read a malformed packet trace file, causing a Denial of Service.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
